meanings.sent1: After a long day of work, the repetitive tasks started tyring me out.
meanings.sent2: The movie was so dull that it ended up tyring everyone in the audience.
meanings.sent3: The never-ending lecture on a topic I already knew was tyring but also a bit funny.
meanings.sent4: The monotonous sound of the clock ticking was tyring, like a constant reminder of time slipping away.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's droning voice was so tyring that even the most energetic students struggled to stay awake.

meanings.definition: The act of putting on a tire or wheel
meanings.sent1: The mechanic's quick tyring of the new tire impressed the customers.
meanings.sent2: He demonstrated the proper tyring technique to avoid any accidents on the road.
meanings.sent3: Watching the tire change was oddly satisfying, like witnessing a tyring ballet performance.
meanings.sent4: The tyring of the wheel symbolized the beginning of a new journey for the car.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of the tyring machine echoed through the garage, signaling another successful repair.

meanings.definition: The act of fitting a tire on a wheel
meanings.sent1: The tyring of the wheel required precision and skill to ensure a snug fit.
meanings.sent2: She observed the seamless tyring process with fascination and curiosity.
meanings.sent3: The tyring of the tire onto the wheel seemed like a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic's expertise in tyring was evident in the flawless finish of the job.
meanings.sent5: The satisfying click of the tire tyring onto the wheel was music to the ears of the car owner.
